conclusion: The liquid from A flows down the blue tube.
The blue tube is directed towards container D.
Liquid from A will flow into container D.
The liquid from B flows down the orange tube.
The orange tube initially goes towards the center.
The tube then bends to the right, directing the liquid into container E.
Liquid from B will flow into container E.
The liquid from C flows down the green tube.
The green tube is angled to the right and leads into container E.
Liquid from C will flow into container E.
Container D will receive liquid from A.
Container E will receive liquid from B and C.
